description: A micro-lesson that makes Constraint as Creative Fuel usable.

hook.text: One lens. One location. One hour. Constraints don't limit creativity â€” they ignite it.

buildup.text: Unlimited options create paralysis. When everything is possible, nothing feels urgent or focused.

discovery.text: Self-imposed limits â€” shoot only in black and white, use only 50mm, stay within one block â€” force inventive seeing.

twist.text: History's most creative periods often came from limitation. Scarcity of film made every frame count.

climax.text: Constraints push you past the obvious. When the easy option is removed, the interesting one appears.

punchline.text: Fewer options, more creativity. Limits set you free.

quiz.question: How do constraints improve creative photography?
options: They force inventive seeing by eliminating obvious easy options
